title: Heavy showers above 100 mm expected today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Southern and Eastern provinces.

title: Mexico’s security chief quietly forms an elite force to take on the drug cartels
byline: Six years ago Mexico’s president disbanded the country’s Federal Police and handed security responsibilities fully to the military. Now, his successor has quietly begun to build an elite civilian investigative and special operations force to fight the drug cartels.

title: Suspects arrested over two shooting incidents in Southern Province
byline: Police have arrested two suspects in connection with separate shooting incidents reported in the Ambalangoda and Ambalantota police divisions.

title: Farmers criticize govt. over delayed fertilizer subsidy
byline: The National Farmers’ Union has raised concerns over the government’s failure to implement a fertilizer subsidy plan for the ‘Yala’ cultivation season.

title: Shammi Silva appointed to three ICC committees
byline: Shammi Silva, who was recently re-elected uncontested as the Chairman of Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) for the fourth consecutive term, has been appointed to three key committees of the International Cricket Council (ICC).

title: Cory Booker breaks record for longest Senate speech after 24 hours
byline: US Senator Cory Booker has broken the record for the longest speech ever delivered in the Senate.

title: Police raid in search of Ishara Sewwandi, seize narcotics in Anuradhapura
byline: Sri Lanka Police has conducted a raid at a hotel in Anuradhapura following a tip-off regarding the whereabouts of Ishara Sewwandi, the fugitive female suspect in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, alias “Ganemulla Sanjeewa.”

title: Sri Lanka records over 720,000 tourist arrivals in first quarter of 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) has reported that a total of 229,298 tourists have arrived in the country in March 2025.

title: Ex-chief minister SM Ranjith sentenced to 16 years RI
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced former Chief Minister of the North Central Province S.M. Ranjith and his Private Secretary Shanthi Chandrasena to 16 years of rigorous imprisonment after they were found guilty of corruption charges.

title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.3 hits Pakistan, tremors felt in several parts of country
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 4.3 on the Richter Scale struck Pakistan in the wee hours of Wednesday. According to the National Center for Seismology (NCS), the tremors were felt in several parts of the country at around 2.58 am (IST).

title: Putin begins biggest Russian military call-up in years
byline: President Vladimir Putin has called up 160,000 men aged 18-30, Russia’s highest number of conscripts since 2011, as the country moves to expand the size of its military.

title: Val Kilmer, film star known for ‘Top Gun,’ ‘Batman Forever’ and ‘Tombstone,’ dead at 65
byline: Val Kilmer, a movie star in the 1980s and ‘90s who played everything from Batman to Doc Holliday, died on Tuesday, according to his daughter Mercedes Kilmer, who released a statement to the New York Times and the Associated Press. He was 65.

title: Govt. launches new programme to provide affordable and nutritious meals
byline: A new government initiative aimed at ensuring food security and making nutritious meals affordable for the public was officially launched on Tuesday (01) at the “Palessa” restaurant of the National Food Promotion Board in Narahenpita.

title: Motion to remove Deshabandu from IGP post to be tabled in Parliament next week
byline: The Speaker of the Parliament Dr. Jagath Wickremeratne has informed that the motion to remove Deshabandu Tennakoon, who is in remand custody, from his post as Inspector General of Police (IGP), will be presented to parliament on April 08.

title: Three sub-committees appointed to address transport sector issues
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation, Bimal Ratnayake, has taken steps to appoint three sub-committees responsible to the Ministerial Consultative Committee for resolving problems prevailing in the transport sector through transport-, environment-, business-and people - friendly concepts.

title: Election activities of several LG bodies including CMC suspended further
byline: The Court of Appeal has further suspended carrying out activities related to conducting Local Government (LG) Elections for institutions where petitions have been filed challenging the rejection of nomination papers.

title: Stalin to introduce resolution in Tamil Nadu assembly to retrieve Katchatheevu
byline: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin is set to present a resolution in the state assembly regarding getting Katchatheevu island back. According to the resolution, “retrieval of Katchatheevu Island is the only permanent solution to protect the traditional fishing of Tamil Nadu fishermen.”

title: LG Polls: Appeals Court issues order on rejected nominations
byline: The Court of Appeal has directed the Election Commission to accept 2025 Local Government (LG) Election nominations from candidates who have submitted original birth certificates, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: CAA releases weekly estimated food prices
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has released estimated price ranges for essential food items.

title: Govt. focuses on further import of rice
byline: The Food Policy and Security Committee has recommended the importation of rice in the near future to ensure an uninterrupted supply for consumers.

title: Sri Lanka pledges $1M in humanitarian aid to Myanmar relief efforts
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has pledged USD 1 million in humanitarian aid to assist ongoing relief and recovery efforts in Myanmar, in the aftermath of devastating earthquake.

title: Ministerial Committee appointed to study sanctions imposed by UK on 4 Sri Lankans
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has decided to appoint a committee comprised of ministers to submit a report with recommendations to the Cabinet of Ministers related to the decisions taken by the United Kingdom to impose sanctions on 4 Sri Lankan individuals including General Shavendra Silva recently.

title: Ven. Rajangane Saddharathana Thero expelled
byline: The Sri Lanka Ramanna Maha Nikaya’s Working Committee has decided to expel Ven. Rajangane Saddharathana Thero from the Sangha (monastic community).

title: Immigration Dept’s regional office to be established in Jaffna
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to establish a regional office of the Department of Immigration and Emigration within the District Secretariat premises of Jaffna within this month (April), Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.
